result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 9/23/15
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 9/11/15
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 10/7/15
Defendant Lorenzo Nmi Ellis in court, in custody, with attorney Adam J. Schleis.   David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case is dismissed and read into Case # 15CM1749.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 09-23-2015 10:30 am

Defendant Lorenzo Ellis in court, in custody, with attorney Adam J. Schleis.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense requests an immediate plea and sentencing date. Court grants.
Attorney Schleis requests the Court order the Waukesha County Jail to provide a reason why the defendant is in lock-down for reasons stated on the record. Defense requests an expediated evaluation of his status. 
Court declines to order the jail to provide this information. 
Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Hearing at 10-07-2015 10:30 am

Defendant Lorenzo Nmi Ellis in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests a 2 week adjournment. State has no objections. Court grants. (Deft. is excused from the next hearing if the matter is not resolved.)  Hearing scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 10:30 am.
